title: Storing Passwords Safely
description: Never store passwords as plain text. Always hash them!
content:
Storing passwords directly is risky. If someone steals your data, they'll get everyone's real password.

Instead, we use something called **hashing** to protect them. Here's how to hash a password in each framework. We're just learning â€” this won't store or save anything yet.

flask.code:
from werkzeug.security import generate_password_hash
hashed_pw = generate_password_hash('mypassword')

express.code:
const bcrypt = require('bcrypt');
const hash = await bcrypt.hash('mypassword', 10);

django.code:
from django.contrib.auth.hashers import make_password
hashed_pw = make_password('mypassword')
